member.name: P:Relativity.Telemetry.APM.IAPM.APMMetadata
member.summary: Metadata of the APM client.

member.name: M:Relativity.Telemetry.APM.IAPM.CountOperation(System.String,System.Guid,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.Object},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Relativity.Telemetry.APM.ISink})
member.summary: Creates a new counter which can be used to increment or decrement a long value.
member.param: The name of the counter, for example 'Page visits'.
Identifier for the workspace, assuming this metric comes from one. Can be set to empty guid if no workspace is valid.
The correlation identifier. Can be used to associate multiple metrics.
The unit of measure, for example 'hits'.
Indicates if a change in the counter needs to be written to the sink directly. By default enabled. When disabled, you need to explicitly call the Write() method to output the current value.
Number of calls to Increment or Decrement before writing an event to the log
Custom Data to provide with the metric.
Any additional sinks to which this metric should be written to in addition to the defaults provided by the APM class.

member.name: M:Relativity.Telemetry.APM.IAPM.TimedOperation(System.String,System.Guid,System.String,System.Object,System.Boolean,System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan},System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.Object},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Relativity.Telemetry.APM.ISink})
member.summary: Begins an operation by placing the code to be timed inside a using block. When the block is being exited, the time it took is sent to the sink. In addition you can specify a warning limit. If it takes more time to execute the code than the specified limit, another message will be sent to the sink.
member.param: The name of the timer, for example 'TimeInQueue'.
Identifier for the workspace, assuming this metric comes from one. Can be set to empty guid if no workspace is valid.
The correlation identifier. Can be used to associate multiple metrics.
The identifier used for the timing. If non specified, a random guid will be used. The object used must be serializable.
If set to true create a start entry for the timer operation.
Specifies a limit. If the measure is longer than this limit, an aditional measure will be sent notifying the limit has been exceded. By default the limit is not set.
Custom Data to provide with the metric.
Any additional sinks to which this metric should be written to in addition to the defaults provided by the APM class.
member.returns: A disposable object. Wrap this inside a using block so the dispose can be called to stop the timing.

member.name: M:Relativity.Telemetry.APM.IAPM.TimedOperation(System.String,System.Double,System.Guid,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.Object},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Relativity.Telemetry.APM.ISink})
member.summary: Logs a single TimeSpan that has already been obtained outside this framework.
member.param: The name of the timer, for example 'TimeInQueue'.
The elapsed time in milliseconds.
Identifier for the workspace, assuming this metric comes from one. Can be set to empty guid if no workspace is valid.
The correlation identifier. Can be used to associate multiple metrics.
Custom Data to provide with the metric.
Any additional sinks to which this metric should be written to in addition to the defaults provided by the APM class.
member.returns: A disposable object. Wrap this inside a using block so the dispose can be called to stop the timing.
member.example:
See the example how to wrap
TimeSpan precalcTime = DateTime.UTCNow - previouslyRunDateTime APM.TimedOperation("Custom.Timer", precalcTime)

member.name: M:Relativity.Telemetry.APM.IAPM.StartTimedOperation(System.String,System.Guid,System.String,System.Object,System.Boolean,System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan},System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.Object},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Relativity.Telemetry.APM.ISink})
member.summary: Starts a timed operation and holds onto it in memory. This allows the operation to be started in one method and stoped in another method. Uses the to create a more unique measure identifier. In addition you can specify a warning limit. If it takes more time to execute the code than the specified limit, another message will be sent to the sink.
member.param: The name of the timer, for example 'TimeInQueue'.
Identifier for the workspace, assuming this metric comes from one. Can be set to empty guid if no workspace is valid.
The correlation identifier. Can be used to associate multiple metrics.
The identifier used for the timing. If non specified, a random guid will be used. The object used must be serializable.
If set to true create a start entry for the timer operation.
Specifies a limit. If the measure is longer than this limit, an aditional measure will be sent notifying the limit has been exceded. By default the limit is not set.
Custom Data to provide with the metric.
Any additional sinks to which this metric should be written to in addition to the defaults provided by the APM class.
member.returns: An identifier for this TimedOperation.

member.name: M:Relativity.Telemetry.APM.IAPM.EndTimedOperation(System.String)
member.summary: Stops tracking a timed operation. This will send the time the measure has been running for to the sinks.
member.param: The identifier for the timed operation.

member.name: M:Relativity.Telemetry.APM.IAPM.CancelTimedOperation(System.String)
member.summary: Stops tracking a timed operation. This will not send the measure to the sinks.
member.param: The identifier for the timed operation.

member.name: M:Relativity.Telemetry.APM.IAPM.CreateTimedIdentifier(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a semi-unique identifier from the given parameters.
member.param: The measure name, e.g. "Relativity.Conversion.CacheHitDuration"
The (optional) correlation ID; usually ArtifactID converted to string.

member.name: M:Relativity.Telemetry.APM.IAPM.GaugeOperation``1(System.String,System.Func{``0},System.Guid,System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.Object},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Relativity.Telemetry.APM.ISink})
member.summary: Retrieves a value as defined by the operation. For example the number of items inside a queue. Call the Write() method to actually read the value and write to log.
member.param: The name of the counter, for example 'Queue size'.
The actual function to retrieve the value from.
The workspace Guid.
The correlation ID.
The unit of measure, for example 'item(s)'.
Custom Data to provide with the metric.
Any additional sinks to which this metric should be written to in addition to the defaults provided by the APM class.
member.typeparam: Numeric type of Int32, Int64, or Double
member.returns: Returns a IGaugeMeasure on which you can call the Write() function to output to the sink.

member.name: M:Relativity.Telemetry.APM.IAPM.TimedGaugeOperation``1(System.String,System.Func{``0},System.TimeSpan,System.Guid,System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.Object},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Relativity.Telemetry.APM.ISink},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Retrieves a value as defined by the operation. For example the number of items inside a queue. The operation is triggered automatically on a defined interval.
member.param: The name of the counter, for example 'Queue size'.
The actual function to retrieve the value from.
How often the operation is triggered automatically.
The workspace Guid.
The correlation ID.
The unit of measure, for example 'item(s)'.
Custom Data to provide with the metric.
Any additional sinks to which this metric should be written to in addition to the defaults provided by the APM class.
The flag that allows user to run the task as soon as the method is called
member.typeparam: Numeric type of Int32, Int64, or Double
member.returns: Returns a ITimedGaugeMeasure on which you can call the Write() function to output to the sink.

member.name: M:Relativity.Telemetry.APM.IAPM.HealthCheckOperation(System.String,System.Func{Relativity.Telemetry.APM.HealthCheckOperationResult},System.Guid,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.Object},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Relativity.Telemetry.APM.ISink})
member.summary: Creates a new health check. When the Write method is executed, the health function is run and the response is written to the sink.
member.param: Name of the health check.
Health function to execute.
The workspace Guid.
The correlation ID.
Custom Data to provide with the metric.
Any additional sinks to which this metric should be written to in addition to the defaults provided by the APM class.
member.returns: Returns an IHealthMeasure on which you can call the Write() function to output to the sink. The check.

member.summary: Creates a new health check that takes in a parameter. When the Write method is executed, the health function is run with the parameter passed into the Write method and the response is written to the sink.
member.param: Name of the health check.
Health function to execute.
The workspace Guid.
The correlation ID.
Custom Data to provide with the metric.
Any additional sinks to which this metric should be written to in addition to the defaults provided by the APM class.
member.returns: Returns an on which you can call Write(T) function with parameter to output to the sink.

example.code: var health = apm.HealthCheckOperation<int>(null, "Queue Depth", "checking call", () => Check(b)); health.Write(10);

member.name: T:Relativity.Telemetry.APM.Sinks.Core.BatchedConnectionStatus
member.summary: Manages reconnection period and transient fault response for . During normal operation an object of this type will simply echo the configured batch transmission period. When availabilty fluctuates, the class tracks the number of failed attempts, each time increasing the interval before reconnection is attempted (up to a set maximum) and at predefined points indicating that either the current batch, or entire waiting queue, should be dropped. This Serves two purposes - first, a loaded receiver may need a temporary reduction in traffic while coming back online. Second, the sender needs to account for both bad batches (the first fault response) and also overproduction (the second, queue-dropping response). In combination these should provide a reasonable delivery effort but ultimately protect the sender from memory exhaustion.
member.remarks: Currently used only by , but may provide the basis for a "smart" exponential backoff timer. There are other factors to consider including the desire to send batches "when full" rather than continuing to buffer, and so-on.

member.name: T:Relativity.Telemetry.APM.Sinks.PeriodicBatchingSink
member.summary: Base class for sinks that send events in batches. Batching is triggered asynchronously on a timer.
member.remarks: To avoid unbounded memory growth, events are discarded after attempting to send a batch, regardless of whether the batch succeeded or not. Implementers that want to change this behavior need to either implement from scratch, or embed retry logic in the batch emitting functions.

member.name: T:Relativity.Telemetry.APM.Types.AtomicLong
member.summary:
Provides lock-free atomic read/write utility for a long value. The atomic classes found in this package are meant to replicate the java.util.concurrent.atomic package in Java by Doug Lea. The two main differences are implicit casting back to the long data type, and the use of a non-volatile inner variable.
The internals of these classes contain wrapped usage of the System.Threading.Interlocked class, which is how we are able to provide atomic operation without the use of locks.
member.remarks: It's also important to note that ++ and -- are never atomic, and one of the main reasons this class is needed. I don't believe its possible to overload these operators in a way that is autonomous.

member.returns: The value after incrementing.
